intro: Dichrostachys richardiana, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
